intro: Kernera decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive kernera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that resemble those of other plants, potentially aiding in pollination. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its leaves are alternate and often have a distinctive lobed shape. Kernera decipiens is also noted for its ability to produce both showy and less conspicuous flowers, which may play a role in its reproductive strategy.
